To enable SMS notifications: 1) Go to Notification Settings 2) Check 'Enable SMS Notifications' 3) Select your preferred frequency 4) Click 'Save Preferences'. Note: SMS notifications are disabled by default for privacy and cost reasons. Standard messaging rates may apply.

To disable SMS notifications: 1) Go to Notification Settings 2) Uncheck 'Enable SMS Notifications' 3) Click 'Save Preferences'. This will immediately stop all SMS alerts from being sent to your phone.

patterns: how often do I get updates?
responses: You can set your SMS notification frequency in the Notification Settings. Options include different time intervals (in seconds) between alerts. The frequency determines how often you'll receive irrigation updates and system status messages.

To test your SMS settings: 1) Ensure SMS notifications are enabled 2) Click 'Send Test SMS' button 3) You'll immediately receive a test message with current sensor data. This helps verify your phone number and settings are working correctly.

⚠️ Important: Standard messaging rates may apply for SMS notifications. These are disabled by default for privacy and cost reasons. Enable them only if you want to receive regular updates and are aware of potential carrier charges.

patterns: what types of alerts will I get?
responses: SMS notifications include: irrigation status updates, system alerts, sensor data readings, maintenance reminders, and important system events. Test messages include current sensor data to verify your system is working properly.

SMS notifications are disabled by default for privacy reasons. When enabled, messages contain only essential irrigation system information. We recommend enabling them only if you're comfortable receiving system updates via SMS.

The system can send emergency alerts for critical issues like system failures, major leaks, or pump failures. These alerts may be sent regardless of your general notification settings for safety reasons. Check your Notification Settings for emergency alert options.

patterns: why am I not getting texts?
responses: If you're not receiving notifications: 1) Check that SMS notifications are enabled 2) Verify your phone number is correct 3) Use 'Send Test SMS' to verify functionality 4) Check your phone's message blocking settings 5) Ensure you have cellular signal. If issues persist, contact support.

Currently, notifications are sent based on system events and the frequency you set. For scheduling specific alert times or setting quiet hours, please check advanced settings in your Notification Preferences or contact support for custom notification scheduling options.
